Reviews.Title: “STILL PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Firstgogirl
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time I have stayed at HDSG with my small groups of You Go GIrls! women. I had not one complaint from anyone. The new owner has continued the same level of personal attention as in previous stays. My only comment is that the fragrance of the sachets in the public areas is too strong. The rooms and bathrooms are clean, the rooms charming and the street relatively quiet. I love having a refrigerator in the room for snacks. The breakfast is perfectly adequate. The location cannot be beat with easy access to The Louvre and Metro stops. Many restaurants are near and also a grocery store for you to purchase picnic items. The reception staff is superlative in their service.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Museumsfreak
Reviews.Content: We got all adequat information we needed at the reception. All personell talked as good english as any norwegian! The lift was as usual in frech hotels - very small but enough for two persons and a little luggage. The room was better than expected from other hotel experience in Paris. Good twin beds and two chairs and a desk. Bathroom ok. Some noice from the street when open window but we selpt well. The hotel is situated 200 m from Pont Neuf and is an excellent base for central Paris, Train to Airport just 400 m away. It is a lot of restaurants of all kinds in the neighbourhood. My wifr and me enjoyd our stay for an oval weekend here.

Reviews.Title: “my birthday "treat" in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gillian e
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Dauphine even if the room was a bit small " we are used to a small bedroom but not quite so small!" and only a wardrobe for clothes .The bathroom was as well good job we are only small people! Could do with a shelf for toiletries and a hook on back of door but these are only small things.The room itself was warm ,clean and bed comfortable what more do you need! It was a bit noisy we were in the front but only one night kept awake by noisy people .We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel easy to find ,we travelled on the Metro quite a bit and found it easy to get around once you had the hang of getting a ticket!The hotel is well placed for restaurants and the Seine and its many bridges is only a stones throw away.We would certainly consider coming back to this hotel if we come again to Paris.It was a lovely birthday treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but some small irritations!”
Reviews.Author: kate k
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending two nights at this hotel over the weekend. First, the plus points. Having done a lot of research, I think we got a really good price for such a centrally located property. And it is in a great location for Paris. St. Germain is a lovely, buzzy area with a plethora of wonderful places to eat. Rue Dauphine houses some wonderful little boutiques, a specialist chocolate shop, some wonderful shops for leather bags, art galleries and studios. It is a stones throw from the Seine and we only used the metro to get from the Gare du Nord and back - because pretty much everything was in walking distance. So overall, great. But there were a couple of things that could be improved: 1) the guy on reception when we arrived was not exactly friendly!! When you've been travelling all day, it makes a BIG difference to get a smile and a warm welcome. Sadly, this was lacking and will be one of the key things we remember. The other people on reception (particularly the gentleman on the day we left) were much better! Yes, there can be cultural differences but staff need to be trained to the expectations of visiting guests! 2) We had requested a courtyard room and were given a street facing room (with no explanation). We were so tired when we arrived we couldn't be bothered to go back down to Reception (and face Mr. Grumpy)....this was a mistake as it was pretty noisy on both Friday and Saturday nights. I wear ear plugs and could still hear some noise from revellers - this was partly due to the fact that on the Friday night, the aircon didn't seem to be working so we had to sleep with a window open. It had been 21C in Paris that day (yes in March!) and it was very hot in the room. This was sorted for us on the Saturday. 3) We didn't have breakfast there (we were on a room-only basis) but personally when in Paris I prefer to grab a croissant, baguette, coffee and OJ from one of the local cafes which is much more atmospheric and cheaper too... But, we've given it 4 stars because the room itself was lovely, atmospheric and the hotel is in a fab location (a quieter side street would be even more preferable). Making sure that every guest is greeted with warmth would go a long way to making this hotel even better and make guests feel that reception are more approachable. Thanks for reading! Kate

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back to Los Angeles after a glorious week in Paris. Our stay at the Hotel Dauphine made our stay in St. Germain absolutely perfect. We had a room facing the courtyard garden which was so peaceful and quiet. Coffee service was delivered to our room every morning promptly and each concierge we dealt with was friendly and efficient. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Dauphine when we return to Paris again. Thank you very much for having us last week!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: NICOLE K K
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! You can't get more centrally located than this one! We walked everywhere which was amazing. Saint Germain is a beauty, so atmospheric and trendy. The room was rather small but I guess Parisian hotels are not famous for their spacious rooms. The staff were eager to help and very polite. It was a bit pricey but locationwise it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Hotel Dauphine”
Reviews.Author: mgnb28
Reviews.Content: See selelcting a room section for the details of this section.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Techa P
Reviews.Content: When in Paris I always search for a Parisian hotel and this is one of those. A charming building, comfortable, atmospheric rooms with fabric covered bedhead and curtains and comfortable chairs in just the right places. The modest bathroom has quality fixtures and great hot water. The dining room looks onto the street through sheer curtains so you can assess the day through the privacy of the room. It is elegantly understated; linen chair covers, tablecloths and serviettes, the food is fresh and freshly cooked on request and the service is friendly and fast. Convenient extras eg wireless internet connection, a bar, newspapers and late check out. The concierge speaks English and nothing is a problem. The location is excellent as the area is buzzing with restaurants and bars and a block from the Sienne so one can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in quaint St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: Mavesu
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience at this small hotel. Perfect, safe location, walking distance to le Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, etc. Quiet yet surrounded by restaurants and shops. Walking to subway, bus and reer. Price affordable at this time of year. Unbeatable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - perfect location - warm, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GeoffandRosemarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dauphine for 5 nights in late November 2011. We arrived late morning and were pleased that our room was available. We had a cozy double room on the 3rd or 4th floor with street view. Perfect! The Dauphine is in a wonderful location..short walks to many sights and the Metro. Many boutiques and cafe's in the neighborhood too. The hotel staff was so very kind .. attentive and helpful...making and confirming dinner reservations for us. The price was very reasonable. We would defintely stay here again and recommend the Dauphine to other visitors to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren G
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better location or friendlier staff. Everyone was very helpful and kind at the front desk! The room were very nice and extremely clean. I plan on staying here next time I am in this beautiful city :)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: lovetheworld66
Reviews.Content: Great value for this charming place ideally located in Saint Germain des Pres. Rooms are cosy and well appointed. Breakfast is delicious. Very welcoming staff and helpfull owner. Many great reataurants and shopping area all around. Romantic as can be and perfectly located to move all over in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Left Bank Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: askabarbara
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Highly recommend Hotel Dauphine St.Germain!!! Yes,smallish room,but for one person,it was PERFECT!! The entire Desk staff was courteous & helpful. Great left bank location.2,minutes from metro Odeon,15 min.walk from RERB metro St.Michel/notre Dame.. Decor was charming,neighborhood SO Parisienne,not touristy!!,,Marble bathroom quite large for a small Boutique Hotel,with shower/tub combo. Small armoire with hanging & shelves. VERY comfortable bed.Get a room facing courtyard; very quiet. Use Paris Airport Transfer..www.parisairporttransfer.com to go from Hotel to CDG,23Euros!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly with a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: djh1
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double and a superior twin room for our family of four in this hotel for three nights between Christmas and New Year. We arrived very early in the morning and they said that they had one room ready for us. It was the “superior” double. The room was on the top floor and very tiny with a tiny double bed. The shower was over the bath and had no pole to support the shower, therefore you had to hold the shower hose in your hand. Very difficult to wash long hair! There was also no shower screen or curtain, so water sprayed everywhere. We set out exploring for the day and returned in the afternoon to organise our children’s room. Their room was much, much larger with a great bathroom and proper shower over the bath. I spoke to the man on reception who told me we were definitely in a superior double and that all the rooms were different. We spent the first night in that tiny room. After another difficult shower the next morning, where by husband actually slipped in the bath as there was no mat or not slip surface, we headed back to reception where they said they now had another room free on a lower floor. We had a look at that and it was so much better, larger and again with a proper bathroom. We immediately moved to that room. I get the feeling that they try to fob off their worst room on people arriving early and desperate for a room to freshen up in so beware. Once the room was sorted, the rest of the stay was wonderful. The staff manning the front desk and the tiny bar were lovely. When we complemented them on a wine we were enjoying in the bar, two bottles appeared in our room with compliments. Nothing was ever too much trouble. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as we preferred to go out and try the local brasseries. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten. Within two minutes you are at a variety of restaurants, brasseries and cafes, also at the Seine at Pont Neuf. Five minutes walk has you at St Michel Metro and RER station, or fifteen minutes will have you at the Louvre or d’Orsay. The only reason we are not staying there for our next trip is that there are so many hotels in Paris, it is nice to try something different in a different area. I highly recommend this hotel, but watch which room they give you!

Reviews.Title: “Really rude staff member - avoid”
Reviews.Author: deadbirdbird
Reviews.Content: First the bad. Really rude staff person - lots of shrugs, a 'not my problem' attitude. Even when the hotel made mistakes: room wasn't ready when we arrived, well after check in time, and then they tried to charge us for the breakfasts we'd already paid for. As we were checking out this scumbag was actually miming phoning for the police over the unpaid bill. Really ruined this hotel for us. The walls to the rooms are also really thin; we had neighbours talking late into the night every night, and we could hear petty much every word. Very annoying. So personally I'd not stay here again. Which is a shame, because the good was actually very good: the other staff there were polite and helpful, the poor breakfast lady especially was working super hard. And the location is very, very good: near the tourist spots, but also in the middle of some good bars and restaurants. If I were you I'd try and find a better hotel in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 61adventuregirl
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to give an "average" to this hotel, but we were disappointed. We visited in the summer and booked two superior double rooms for three nights for a pretax total of 934 Euros, which did not include breakfast. The location is handy and quiet, tucked in a side street, with no views to speak of. The rooms we were given were so tiny and cramped, with small windows – I was amazed they were called "superior." But the hotel was clean and most of the staff members were polite. We have stayed in Paris before and there are better values to be found.

Reviews.Title: “It's my "house" in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo V
Reviews.Content: It's small, it's not cheap (it's not expensive either - hey, you are in Paris), but it extremely well placed and the concierges are very nice. The rooms are small, but fair. Here, you are near to everything in Paris. I try to stay there every time I go.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, and quite well located”
Reviews.Author: driber9
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my family, it was awesome, its comfortable, not big, but still well organized, it's near the best zones in saint germain in a few steps away the street. i don't think rooms are able to comfort more people than how many people it's said to suit in thank you for everything! au revoir

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Marty K
Reviews.Content: Two blocks to Pont Neuf, the Metro and RER! Walk everywhere! Safe area, lots of cafe's and even a grocery nearby. Clean room, excellent bed, great bathroom, quiet (on the back), good breakfast, great, great staff and very gracious owner. Thanks so much and I can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Florian D
Reviews.Content: Being French but based in London, we were looking for a place in Paris to spend the holiday season with our family while enjoying the city as "tourists". This hotel offered us the perfect combination of being wonderfully located for shopping, cinema, cafe, restaurants and providing a perfect service with excellent staff, a good french breakfast, lovely rooms and fair room rates. We were even upgraded for our last 3 nights. We highly recommend this hotel and look forward to come back. Flo&Flo

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tomclubireland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent neighborhood. Skip the expensive breakfast and try one of the many choices in the neighborhood - there is even a Paul around the corner. We got a regular room, and it was very cozy but had everything we needed and was big enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value”
Reviews.Author: toffeenose
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but with nice French decor. Our room had lovely exposed beams making it an intersting combination of modern and old. We had a comfortable king bed. If you are bothered by noise don't stay at the front. On the other hand the near by bar closes at 1AM on the weekends after that it is very quiet. Since we were also out enjoying the Paris night life it did not bother us. The staff were friendly. We did not eat breakfast but it looked OK .There are so many lovely places to have breakfast nearby that we went to a different cafe everyday. Whether you want to go to Paris to visit the museums just walk the streets or window shop for patisseries or party dresses this hotel has a great location and ambience

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: MedSkier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week during our honeymoon. It was clean and comfortable. The rooms are not very spacious, but for the price in Paris, it is a great deal. The only word of caution is to make sure to request a room that does not face the street. There is a bar next door that always has people outside late at night. We had read ahead and had a room facing in. It was very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiskyVance
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of friends earlier this year. The rooms were cozy and quiet and the bed was great. The breakfast was a time and money saver as well. Staff was great and not as stuffy as some we have experienced at other hotels in Paris. Location is great and within walking distance to many key sights. We will be back next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at Hotel Dauphine Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: pmaloney42
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Sept 17, 2011 for a five night stay. The hotel is in a good location and is centrally located. However, I cannot recommend the hotel because of how we were treated upon our arrival. We arrived early on the morning of Sept 17 and were told that check-in was at noon, which was fine by us. After walking around for a bit we returned to the hotel and were given the keys to a small room in the attic with a double bed. I had paid in advance for a larger room with a king sized bed. The hotel clerk (Michael) insisted that all of the rooms and beds in the hotel were the same size and basically "take it or leave it". He also told me that breakfast was not included in my rate. I had it in writing on my confirmation that breakfast was included and that we had a larger room with a king sized bed. Having now been awake for over 24 hours and being exhausted, i gave up and went to my room. This room was so small that I could not get all of my luggage and my wife and I in the room at the same time. I went downstairs again to complain when I happened to walk past a room on the first floor (#11) whose door happened to be open with two maids finishing their cleaning. I asked them if this was a junior suite and they informed me this was a normal room with a king sized bed. I went down to the front desk and calmly told Michael that I saw room #11 and that it had a king sized bed. Knowing that I caught him in a lie, he started screaming at me and told me I should not be "snooping around the hotel." I then barked back and demanded to speak with the hotel manager. He refused and said the manager was out of the country. I told him I was not leaving the lobby until he gave us a different room. After a few minutes, he ended up giving me room #11 but still insisted that breakfast was not included. Having at least now a room that I could fit my luggage in, I went upstairs to settle in. The next morning I came down to complain about breakfast not being included. The manager told me it was included and tried to pretend like nothing had happened. This was not the way I wanted to start my 15 days in France and Belgium. I felt like I was being taken advantage of and only when I had proof did they make it right. For that reason, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A St Germain gem”
Reviews.Author: JohnO628
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and extremely comfortable hotel in a brilliant location. The owner and staff have great attention to detail and nothing is too much for them. Very reasonable prices. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaShiraz
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor we stayed at this hotel in August 2011. I cannot find a fault with the hotel. We tried the breakfasts on offer at the cafes but found that the hotel offered a cheaper and far superior breakfast without having to deal with snooty French waiters. t The room was compact but beautifully furnished and the staff were very helpful.the location is within walking distance of major sightseeing locations and close to good restaurants with a vibrant nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Teamstar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and service. Staff did all they could to help and assist, even in English. Rooms were comfy and very nice. Hotel was a lovely French setting and very clean. We loved our stay and would recommend for anyone wanting to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service; nice room”
Reviews.Author: trvlquestions
Reviews.Content: Great location...we walked almost everywhere. Great service...particularly from Ludovic Piniello (the manager?). He was incredibly helpful and patient with all of our questions. The room was typically small but well appointed and clean; the bathroom was spacious. After reading some of the reviews about noise from the pub a few doors away, I requested an inside room. We were given an inside room on one of the upper floors, and it was very quiet. We never opt for the hotel breakfast, preferring to find a local patisserie; the food is much better, we can mingle with the locals, and the cost is always less. They do need to update the computer that guests can use; I could never get into my email. All in all we were quite satisfied with the room for the 2 nights we were in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel, it's little a bed and breakfast place!”
Reviews.Author: erindalian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon trip to Italy and France for 4 nights in August 2011. We got a room on the second floor (it's the first floor to them) but we asked for one on a higher floor to avoid the noise. The room we stayed in is exactly like a doll house, which is a little bit creepy. There room is tiny but it's clean and comfortable. Compared to the hotels in Italy, the AC works wonderfully and the bed is so much more comfortable. The front desk staff are so nice and helpful. The breakfast was disappointing but the eating space is very elegant looking. The business area is located in a dingy room in the basement with a dinosaur PC so we ended up using the free wifi for our phone. St. Germain is an charming area with lots of restaurants and unique stores. It is not that close to other attractions though but it's near the metro, which we found to be a bit complex. There's a larger commercial-style hotel up the street but it's 50 euros more per night..it looks like a place we would stay the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a treasure! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy D
Reviews.Content: OMG, this darling boutique hotel is fabulous! We stayed here during our romantic trip to Paris, and loved the hotel! It is charmingly small, quaint, clean, with all amenities and does much to enhance the experience of staying in the Latin Quarter. The location could not be better for walking to many main attractions, local shops and great restaurants. The service was excellent from breakfast to the late night desk man. The new owner has done many upgrades and provided special touches which enhance the charm. We felt perfectly at home and spoiled at the same time. Definitely recommended to anyone who wants a real Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Bridie31
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely little hotel in the heart of the 6th arrondissement. The location couldn't have been better - fabulous cafes and shops just around the corner, a short stroll to the Seine and Notre Dame - fantastic. So close in fact we could see Notre Dame from our window and were awakened by its bells. The hotel itself was delightful, we were upgraded to a junior suite and had a lovely room that we shared with our nearly 3 year-old daughter. The staff were lovely and helpful. We would definitely go back and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: AD2222222
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel many years ago, and while the location is just fantastic, I had found the hotel very old fashioned and lacking attention to detail. I had been told by a relation that they had changed management, so I decided to give it another try as I love this area of Paris. Though apparently the new management had literally just taken over, I noticed some great improvements. The hotel was more modern, while keeping its cachet. My bedroom and bathroom were both very clean, the bed very comfortable and no noise heard from either the street nor the inside of the hotel, which in Paris is most rare. It is worth mentioning the quality of the product used for the breakfast, with proper orange juice and delicious ham and cheese. This is really a great value for money, charming place to stay in Paris whether on business or for pure pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Noemptymind
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, but this is Paris! If you find a room which is large and doesn't cost the earth, then you are very fortunate. The staff are very helpful and friendly, the rooms are comfortable and the road outside is not too busy. It's within reach of lots of interesting places, including cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't book this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: zimfamtravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dauphine for 4 nights during our recent trip to Europe. We are a 40-ish couple visiting Paris for the first time. This is a small hotel on a cute street in the St. Germain area. The positives are the location--Rue Dauphine becomes Pont Neuf and is only a block or two from Ile de la Cite, the Seine river and MANY, many outdoor cafes and restaurants. If you are looking for an area with a lively nightlife, this is your spot! The desk clerks were always helpful, but reserved. The hotel itself is well-mainted, but tiny. After a great deal of research, I was prepared for small rooms. They were tiny. Tiny lobby, tiny elevator, tiny rooms, tiny bathroom. We booked a Superior room with the requested two twin beds pushed together to make a king (we are used to sleeping on a king bed and many of the double beds in Europe are very small). This was not the room they initially tried to give us. We refused the initial room, as it was not what we had booked. The superior room was very claustrophobic. I was constantly bumping knees and elbows trying to move around the room or get ready in the bathroom. Our room faced Rue Dauphine- Paris stays up VERY late at night. Even when we would return to our room at 12 or 1am, we were kept awake most of the night by the partying on the street. Then, once that would die down, the garbage trucks and delivery trucks would move in early in the a.m. It was VERY noisy and we are generally pretty tolerant. Mayge requesting a room that doesn not face the street would be helpful? Overall, not a horrible place, but not one we would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little Dauphine”
Reviews.Author: WendsPaisley
Reviews.Content: Had I written this review a few days ago, it may have been slightly different and probably a little subjective. An issue which occurred while we stayed there is currently being resolved by the (new) Management and whilst still to be completely closed-off, his attitude and approach thus far has left me confident and happy that it will be rectified. Thank you once again Ludovic, as per my email you are a true ambassador for La Dauphine and I am happy to recommend your hotel to anyone. So to the facts. This is charming, small hotel in the heart of St Germain. On arrival you notice the beautifully decorated breakfast room and a sweet little bar; we didn't use either so I can't comment on prices. Our room was small, as all such hotels in Paris are, and traditionally decorated with Toile de Joue and a very comfy bed. Not much hanging space but enough for a few days stay. The bathroom was compact and modern, as per the website photos. I have to praise the cleaning staff, they seemed to work very hard. Reception team spoke perfect English if that's a concern for you and did a mini 'security check' one day when I appeared mid-morning asking for our room key. Far from being annoyed, I appreciated this. I originally picked La Dauphine because of its location. I wanted to enjoy the buzz and vibrancy of this part of the city in the middle of summer, particularly at night. As we usually come to Paris in winter, we tend not to spend too much time outdoors after dark so I was looking forward to the atmosphere of the cobbled lanes and drinks al fresco. Didn't quite happen like that as it rained but the potential was definitely there! You truly could not be more central with a multitude of cafes, restaurants and bars right on the hotel doorstep (again handy in the pouring rain). You are also right on the edge of the Seine with Notre Dame, Jardins de Luxembourg etc only a 10 minute walk away. I absolutely recommend this hotel - it is prettily Parisienne, clean and comfortable, in a fantastic location (without any noise problems) and, as I've since discovered, has Management who are professional and courteous. Thank you La Dauphine for making our 7th trip to Paris so enjoyable !

Reviews.Title: “Quality and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: ollymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dauphine Saint Germain for 4 nights during a family trip to Paris. It was a quality hotel in a very convenient location and I feel we got value for our money. The rooms were tiny as to be expected in this area, but very clean and lovely - with large bathrooms. The trade off for convience was a very, very touristy street (next to rue to Bac). But you stay here not to experience the "real" paris, but to be in proximity to all the key sights of central paris. The reason for 4 stars though (vs 5) for me was the inconsistency of the staff. While some of the front desk managers were generous and lovely, another was aloof and calous -- unapologetic when his error put us in jeopardy of missing our train. Look, people make mistakes, but don't be a jerk about it...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: charmm1870
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 1 year old son for 5 nights. The hotel staff were very accommodating. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the rooms were delightful and bathroom spacious considering we are in the heart of Paris. Yes the room was small but all european hotel rooms are! We would definintely come back and stay here again. It was close to everything sites, restaurants, bars, supermarkets everything you would need including train stations. The only complaint that i would make is that sometimes the rooms were cleaned too late in the afternoon, as we would like to bring our little one home for his afternoon nap sometimes we would this difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: Janetrs47
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter was wonderful. Right off the Pont Neuf near Notre Dame, one block off the Seine. Although the rooms were small like most european hotels, they were clean and beautifully decorated. Lots off small winding streets, shops, and restaurants nearby. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: JeremiahSki
Reviews.Content: this hotel seemed like it once tried hard, but has since stopped caring as much. The lobby and eating areas were very nice but the room left much to be desired. The showerhead was moldy with scum, the bathroom door had peeling paint and water damage, the curtains were showing their age with wear, the tissue holder was rusted, and many other small things that just added up to not wanting to spend the money for upkeep. This was rated a 4 star hotel but i would rate no higher than a 3. On the plus side the staff was considerate and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent location, friendly and competent staff, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: MontrealRuth
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris with an 18-year old grandson, and had reserved adjoining rooms. Both rooms were lovely, mine being especially large, and the air conditioning, very necessary the week we were there, worked beautifully. I'd go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: seenitChicago
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor, we booked one night at this hotel. I was so disappointed. One review said the rooms look like the photos on the website. They looked pretty nice, very French. What the photos don't show is that these rooms are very, laughably tiny. While there is lovely wallpaper and decorative sconces, there are also water stains and old carpeting. Our family had booked two rooms. We got one in the front, or street side of the hotel and one in the back. The front room was nice, had a bigger bathroom, but the noise from the bar below! It went on all. night. long. Drunks howling, laughing, talking, shouting, singing, screaming until 5 a.m. And this was a Monday night. I was on an upper floor. The back room was very quiet, but it's window looked out into a sort of well of windows, the only bright spots in a dirty, crumbling wall. Maybe that explained the smell in that room. We arrived at 4 pm and housekeeping was still cleaning our rooms. There seemed to be some trouble between the manager and the housekeeping staff. The housekeeping staff seemed to have taken over the hallways and lone, tiny elevator and when we attempted to use those public spaces to see our rooms we were pushed out of the way by the housekeepers. The two upsides of this hotel? The location is great and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: HHV
Reviews.Content: Since I wanted to see an exposition in Museum Jacqemart-André (about the painter Caillebotte) I had to find a hotel in Paris at short notice. By the way, I have been to Paris many times before. The hotels where I usually stay were booked full, and so were many others, and in the end I wound up at the Dauphine St. Germain. There is definitely nothing wrong with the hotel, but I don’t quite understand the rave reviews on Tripadvisor either. Maybe I was unlucky. I paid 250 euros a night, which I find very expensive for what is really a rather average hotel. I had room 36, and when entering I wound up in a narrow corridor (on the right hand side of which was the bathroom (spacious, marble), than an other small corridor to the left, at the end of which was the room. View on an inner courtyard, two single beds shoved together, rather smallish. Neat, and everything well taken care off, air conditioning functioning fine. But when I returned later at night, after having had dinner, the televison did’ nt. The antenna appeared to be unplugged and I couldn’t find anything to plug it in. No, I really couldn’t. There were all sort of lose wires hanging behind the chest. The door of my closet didn’t close. The hangers were of the wrong kind, you know, the irritating kind. The next morning the elevator didn’t work. Service is okay, personnel is friendly. You have to ring a bell most of the time to enter. I didn’t take breakfast, and not many people did, was my impression. After having been overcharged for my hotel, I didn’t feel like being overcharged for breakfast as well. My televison was repaired the next day. It is my impression that in hotels like this you pay a 100 extra for location and the marble in your bathroom. Because location is the best thing of the hotel of course, situated as it is on Rue Dauphine, at 200 meters from the Seine, with Pont Neuf at the end of the street. You are right in the middle of Saint Germain. Rue Dauphine is a sidestreet from Rue Saint-André des Arts. Nearest metrostation is probably Saint Michel (on line 4, Porte Clignancourt-Porte d’Orleans), but Odeon is not much further (also line 4, next station after Saint Michel, and number 10, Boulogne-Saint Cloud). The only problem (if you wish to consider it so) is that you will probably always have to change metro’s if you really want to go anywhere. On the other hand, you could go to Orsay, Louvre and Notre Dame by foot, although the first two would be a stiff walk. The area around the hotel is lively, and there are many restaurants and cafés, but it is also very expensive and very touristy, if you compare it to the Marais for instance. I paid (to just give an example) 11 euros for a beer (Belgian, white beer, I admit), and 6 for a glass of white wine. Being a somewhat elderly man already I just wondered about one thing. Many, many years ago, as a student, I wound up at a very simple hotel in Rue Dauphine too. It was dirt cheap than, and not just dirt cheap, if you understand what I mean. I kept asking myself: was this the same hotel, but refurbished? No, the personnel was to young to ask. So I didn’t. That was somewhere around 1975. I think I paid 50 francs or so. 50 francs? That is about the equivalent of 8 euros. Those were the days!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SorrelliAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends because other friends had stayed here several years previously - an absolute gem. We had a small room witha lovely roomy bathroom - very unusual for Paris. Our friends had a roomy bedroom with a small bathroom. We were at the back of the hotel and they were at the front Beautifully decorated with toile fabrics and a comforatable bed. The staff were super helpful with my enquiries and nothing was too much trouble. The wifi signal was weak since we had a room that overlooked the other rooms but I was able to use the hotel guest computer downstairs. The hotel has good access to gardens, shops and restaurants and the Seine. A magical part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonestartravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Regent many years ago and loved the location. I wanted to try something different and booked the Hotel Dauphine Saint Germain based on trip advisor reviews and the hotel's website. I am quite happy that I did. The rooms look exactly as they appear on the website. I booked a superior double on their website several months ago (208 euro-quite reasonable for Paris in the summer). It was a little larger than a standard. The king bed is actually 2 twins pushed together. This is Paris so the rooms are very small by American standards. The bathroom is tiny. I only have 2 minor complaints- neither a deal breaker. The safe is a door in the wall about the size of a brick- large enough for passports and a money belt, operated by a key. It should be replaced with the standard room safe bolted into furniture or closets with a digital combination and large enough for an ipad. Our room faced rue Dauphine. The windows are single glazed so we had a lot of noise from the Irish bar a few doors down at night. Double glazed windows would solve that problem. I just used ear plugs. Also the bathroom window needs to be frosted glass so the people who live in the apartments directly across can't see in. Our towel warmer did not work well. Housekeeping came every day usually late in the day. Very efficient. The front desk staff were very nice and friendly with the exception of the late night man. We did not use the bar since we preferred to visit the local cafes for drinks. We did not eat breakfast for 16 euros. We went to the neighborhood patisseries for breakfast. Free wifi was great since we had an ipad with us which we had to leave unsecured in the room. For the price this is a fantastic hotel in a great location. If you are looking for luxury boutique, then be prepared to spend an extra hundred or more euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “the staff”
Reviews.Author: jack48georgia
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself was quite nice we do have one complaint concerning the staff. The maid service was terrible we had to ask for clean wash cloths and glasses and our linens were changed once in 5 days. The staff was very friendly and helpful except the midnight concierge Roland who was very aloof, not helpful in anyway, and acted put out when you rang the buzzer to be let in the hotel in the evening. Even getting a bucket of ice was a big deal to him. I guess no one told him those things fall under his job discription. If he doesn't like his job maybe he should look for another.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel - great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Maidstone7
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel in a wonderful part of Paris. Bakery 3 doors down, Indian Restaurant across the street (great food), 5 minute walk to Metro, just down the street from the Pont Neuf on the Seine. Just a great location. Clean rooms/loo. Cozy room - but most of European hotels are this size. Guy, the front desk manager, was WONDERFUL. Very happy I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and highly recommend it to travelers staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Book early, enjoy the atmosphere and the excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: itsthebish
Reviews.Content: Three day stay, booked five months ahead and based on a careful study of previous trip Advisor reviewers produced very comfortable, exceptionally clean accommodation hosted by excellent staff. Previous reviews have identified the great location, ease of access to Metro/RER and Water Taxis, small but comfortable/cosy rooms and splendid beds. We would like to add that rooms overlooking the street at the front provide a grandstand view of the cosmopolitan nature of the area and the possibility of late night noise. Overall good value for money in a city that has become noticeably more expensive over the last few years.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a wonderful, convenient area”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 minute walk to metro to take you everywhere. Did not eat there, many little restaurants in the area and yes, 2 Starbucks within a few minutes of the hotel. Friendly staff and a nice room for Paris standards (small). The bed took up most of the space with little room for luggage. Short walk to Notre Dam and The Seine where I suggest you get a ticket for the hop on-hop off Batabus (river boat) that takes you to the major tourist sights. Short walk, even with luggage to the metro and RER. Taxi not necessary. Many restaurant options in the area, great place for people watching and enjoying a real Paris neighborhood. Would look there first to book a room when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and quality”
Reviews.Author: P_B_Samson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights, room was cute, clean and modern. The room was a little small as expected in the heart of Paris. The location is extraordinary, almost at the Buci intersection (Mazarin, St-Andre des arts, Dauphine), 2 minutes walk to Pont-Neuf on one side and 2 minutes from Boulevard Saint-Germain on the other side. Plenty of restaurants of all kinds, Haute Cuisine to Bistro. There's even a Starbucks 2 minutes away in case you miss your Venti Mocha :), All kind of shops around, pastries, Chocolate, etc... and not a tourist trap, real people ( a lot ) lives there. Couldn't have found better place, We took it from the good review seen here and we were extremely satisfied. Even a very good high class Thai Massage salon down the street after these long walk across Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful charming gem...”
Reviews.Author: luvtomovetosouthwest
Reviews.Content: I was set on staying at a larger chain hotel until my friends in Paris suggested I stay instead at a boutique style hotel and suggested a few hotels in this area. This hotel is the only one that consistently gets very good reviews and now I know why: 1) The staff, welcoming reception - others have already noted this but they deserve an applause I would say. You are met with the warmest welcome and made to feel at home right away especially since I don't really speak French. Guy at the front desk was so helpful and friendly, and very gracious. The cleaning lady, the lady at the breakfast buffet, all helped to make our stay very comfortable. 2) The rooms - very beautiful (love the decor) comfortable and so clean!!! The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathroom was quite spacious (we stayed at the junior suite). Also, make sure to get the breakfast buffet, wonderful selection of fresh items, best coffee I had. 3) The neighbourhood - very charming, and so close to everything...less than 5 min walk to Pont Neuf, 10 minute walk to the Louvre and the Notre Dame. There are a lot of great boutiques and eateries in this neighbourhood and not so heavily visited by tourists. 4) We took a river cruise on the Seine for only 13 Euros and well worth it (takes you close to the Eiffel Tower so it is nice to see the sights from a different perspective). 5) Access cannot be beat - the Odeon metro is a five minute walk from the hotel, only one line (so you don't need to transfer lines) to the Gare du Nord, takes about 15 minutes. Great if you are catching the Eurostar. Shuttles can be arranged as well to the airport but from Orly Airport, one can easily take the shuttle bus close to the Bievenue Montparnasse metro station, and then it is only about 4 stops away to Odeon (the metro stop for the hotel). There are also RER trains to the airport and the stations are easily accessible from the hotel. Our only regret was that our stay was not long enough, and we would definitely go back to this hotel and will surely recommend it to friends who will be travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: drewcourt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights, 1 at the beginning and 1 at the end of our trip. The staff was very friendly and helpful... even the cleaning staff was friendly and all happily spoke to us in English. When we returned for the 2nd night we checked in very early in the morning and they had our room ready for us! We were able to shower and enjoy the full day because of this service. They even upgraded our room for this to happen. Our first rooms were small but fine, but the second was very spacious. The breakfast was also good. The location is outstanding with great restaurants, cafes, and shopping nearby. We walked to most sites, but there is close access for public transportation. The hotel is very clean and the beds good sized and comfortable. There is free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, all around great deal.”
Reviews.Author: GreatTasteTours
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 20 people and had a great time. Bed were comfy and breakfast was good. The staff was great and seemed very helpful. The only complaint is that there is a bar on the street next to the hotel and they seem to party into the early morning on weekends. So be sure to ask for an inside room if you need quiet to sleep. My room was on the street and the noise wasn't so loud I couldn't sleep and I had nice sights out my window. The neighborhood is great with anything you could walk within 5 block walk. There is grocery store on the other side of the block, which made it nice to get some snacks. It was a $55 Euro cab ride to CDG. Over a good time and very accommodating to our group.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDIreland79
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is hard to beat. Just minutes from the Seine and equally close to Blvd St. Germain, you're right in the heart of Paris. As for the hotel, our room was very nice, as well as being clean and quiet (courtyard facing). The staff were friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was great value. Definitely the place I'll be staying the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tallpig
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days stay at hotel Dauphine. The downside first: the rooms are small and can be noisy if overlooking the road, however we just used the room to crash out in and the beds are comfortable enought to get a good night sleep. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is basic continental with a good choice of meats, cheese, fruit, bread etc. Sets you up for the day. Location is excellent, being 100 metres fro the Seinne and in the centre of St Germain des Pres, with its village feel and good choice of resturants and weight inducing Patisseries. I felt heavy just drooling through the windows. Found a few friendly restruarants close by Cafe De Paris in Rue De Buci and Vins et Terroris in Rue St Andre des Arts.. Both had friendly professional staff and a reasonable choice of meat and Fish dishes. Overall an enjoyable stay and worth considerring. I'd go again

Reviews.Title: “Mother and daughter weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kfromm
Reviews.Content: For a mother and daughter weekend, this small three star boutique hotel is great for a short stay in Paris. It has a very warm country french feel with modern amenities. The staff is wonderful and accommodated our requests. Beds were very comfortable. Baths were very well appointed for todays traveler. The location can't be beat. Just a short couple of blocks to the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame...and great shopping. Many small diverse restaurants and cafe's within walking distance so no need to rely on cabs or the metro. Tip: request a back room if staying over a weekend, smaller hotels with front rooms right on the street might be a little noisier on Saturday nights. Our room was in the back and was perfect. Remember this is the left bank and much more lively with the Sorbonne close by. Very fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATriece
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We were upgraded to the top floor "mini suite" and it was completely charming. We could see the towers of Notre Dame from our window and the bed was heaven. The staff was extremely helpful, very nice and spoke perfect English. The location is unbeatable, just a block or so from the Seine and lots of shopping and patisseries on the street. I whole heartedly recommend the Hotel Dauphine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wizardovoz
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in a great location . A small room but plenty of space for coming home late and resting before exploring Paris the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay. Left Bank. Less than 5 minute walk to Pont Neuf!”
Reviews.Author: dsw24
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are smaller in dimension than one might expect, the Hotel Dauphine is a clean, comfortable, well-run hotel, located within walking distance of Musee du Louvre, Musee de l'Orangerie, Musee d'Orsay, Musee Rodin, Musee Delacroix, Musee de Cluny, and so much more. If you turn to your left and then walk straight ahead along Rue Dauphine, you will (within 5 minutes) be walking on the Pont Neuf. In five more minutes, you will be at the Louvre! After staying at the Hotel Dauphine in January, I've made arrangements to return to the same hotel in March. That's my best recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Adventure of a Lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: dskowron
Reviews.Content: There is not one negative thing to say about Hotel Dauphne St Germain. My daughter, her friend who was studying in Rouen, France and I had the most wonderful time in Paris in large part to this hotel and it's wonderful staff. Especially want to thank our wonderful hostess Farrah! She could not have been more helpful or accommodating If I would ever again get the chance to visit France I would not hesitate and make another reservation to stay at this wonderful quaint hotel right in the middle of Paris. Diana Skowron, Amanda Skowron and Jessalyn

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Paris........”
Reviews.Author: rpgecp
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat; the service was excellent. The rooms are quaint (maybe a little small), but that adds to the ambiance. The breakfast buffet menu could be changed on occasion. Overall for the money, this is a true gem and worth every cent. The neighborhood provides all you could want.

Reviews.Title: “We very much enjoyed our stay in this nice hotel in a great locations.”
Reviews.Author: Mark56003
Reviews.Content: After comparing rates, amenities and locations of other options, my fiance and I selected this hotel for a Christmas vacation in Paris. We were not disappointed. We arrived before noon on the 24th and our room was ready, well before the standard check-in. The room was clearn and comfortable. The breakfast offered a small but more than adequate selection at a reasonable price. The staff was very friendly and helpful with all our requests, from information and directions to obtaining tickets to shows. The location, on a small street in the heart of St. Germain, could not be better if you are visiting the main attractions in central Paris. It is also in the middle of shops and bistro's and bars of all variety. One evening, I left the hotel for wine, bread and cheese, and returned in 15 minutes to enjoy the excellent purchases at three locations within a few short blocks--a rare treat for someone from Texas where most shops are a car trip away. If you enjoy small, boutique hotels, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and super location”
Reviews.Author: Rynholly
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival at this bijou hotel in a super location in St. Germain, Farah, Mehjib and Guy looked after us like old friends. Be it a late cafe au lait, directions to a local store , an ice bucket for our night cap or the much appreciated complementary coupe de champagne with our lunch at the Train Blue, ending with a stress free transfer to CDG on departure, nothing was too much trouble! Our room, while on the small side as is normal in Paris, was very , very, comfortable and we loved the luxury of the textured wall covering (room 14). The bathroom was everything one would desire with a great pressure shower, lots of towels replaced every day, good quality bathroom gels and body lotions etc. and excellent care of our room during our visit. My sister especially liked the boot buffer just at the end of reception! This is our third visit to Paris in early December and we choose a different arrondissment each time. Having stayed in St. Germain we think it would be hard to beat this location and will return again. The beautiful church of St. Germain, people watching while enjoying an expresso or vin rouge at one of the many bars . Walking around the amazing renovated maison Ralph Lauren on Boulevard St. Germain, having an epic meal at L'Epi Dupin and spending hours browsing and buying at Le Bon Marche , the great fun talking in very poor French to the locals, a smile and some good manners go a long way in Paris. And then to return to a cocoon of warmth and security as we did with the Dauphine made our short visit wonderful. We should not forget the great italian restaurant a few doors down from the Dauphine , I think it was called the Mazzarin. When we arrived at 10.30pm on our first night, they fed us and made us laugh, , though that could have been the relief of getting to Paris in the worst weather conditions we have ever known or maybe the very good vin rouge maison! We loved the family atmosphere and returned on our last night for the best Neapolitan pizza and affogato we have ever had . So, what can we say... our trip was everthing we wanted it to be ... and yes we will be coming back to St. Germain to see all the things we missed this trip... an yes we will be staying in your lovely hotel again... it is a perfect jewell in a magnificant setting ... To Farah, Mejhib and Guy , merci beaucoup et felicitation de saison, Au revoir Nuala and Ry

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff, bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Delboy2b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend after spending a lot of time researching hotels in the area. Farah and the rest of the staff are great, they really helped out with everything. The location is perfect, very handy to get to from CDG and very close to a lot of great attractions. The only down side is the street is a bit noisy until the wee hours with a bar pretty much downstairs. The room is small, but that's Paris, it's very cosy and we slept well once the noise died down. If you're not bothered about that it's flawless!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stationsvej
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is good value for money. We enjoyed our staying, the location is just perfect at the end of Pont Neuf in the middle of Saint Germain. The rooms are quite small as they often are in Paris but they are absolutely clean and the staff is very polite, warm and positive, which raises the level of the whole experience of a weekend in Paris. We will surely stay at Hotel Dauphine Saint Germain next time we are in Paris and can give it our best recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay! I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: daveandnina
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of St. Germain...fantastic service and help/advice from Guy and Farah. Breakfasts were great...nice girl (a saxaphone player in training!) made our coffee every day...short walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, metro stops, and please...have a glass of beougolias neuvo at Cafe Conti down the street with the throngs of Parisans! The hotel can arrange an affordable shuttle to CDG too. They told us 30% USA patrons, 20% South America, many return visits ( we will for sure!). As you can tell, we had a great stay there! please please please I want o go back!!!! ;-))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: kwbtattys
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The service was great and the staff was very friendly and made me feel welcome. They all spoke English which was of great assistance to me. The location is great as well and is within walking distance of many major sites. The rooms are a little small, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Below par for the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jdmdiamond
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a dozen hotels in the St. Germain / Latin Quarter / Odeon area, and I know what to expect. I don't generally complain about street noise or small rooms and elevators, because that's to be expected in this neighborhood. When you stay here, you're paying for the location. This hotel has the typical Paris charm and is obviously in a fabulously convenient location, but that's all it has going for it. The rooms are teen tiny even for the neighborhood, and there is no storage space for your luggage or clothes. The "closet" was an armoire with a total of 6 broken hangers that weren't high enough to hang a pair of men's pants, let alone my wife's coat. There was no room to place our two suitcases without tripping over them. The bathroom was a contortionist's wet dream. And we had one of the better rooms facing the street. The building is about large enough for 3 decent rooms per floor, but it was chopped up to turn it into 5, so half of the floor space is hallways, and all the rooms are tiny. When I checked in, the desk clerk gave me an option of two rooms, this one and one in the back. After entering the door to the second room, I had to walk along 2 long hallways in the dark to get to the room proper. The room itself overlooked a dingy stairwell with little light. No thank you. 2 of the 5 rooms on each floor are like this, so you're rolling the dice when you book a room here. Hint: The floor plan displayed on the wall reveals that all the rooms are essentially the same size, so there's no point in booking anything but the lowest price available. I will say that all the staff members are extremely polite and helpful, some of the best I've encountered in Paris, and they did make our stay comfortable. If you're a single traveler and you're lucky and you get a street facing room, you might have a good time. If you're traveling as a couple, just forget it. There are 50 other hotels within a 5 minute walk of this high-traffic neighborhood with its 100 restaurants, bars, and convenience shops. Pick one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation and staff”
Reviews.Author: LancasterHopwood
Reviews.Content: We chose the Dauphine after reading the reviews and would add our recomendation to everyone else's. Firstly the situation of the Hotel is perfect from reaching it via the RER from CDG, couldn't be more simple, no changing lines, a direct route and short walk. Its position in the Latin Quarter is great; slightly away from the more brash tourist area which is across the road from the St Michel Fountain, with it's tourist tat shops and multi-ethnic restaurants. This area reminded me of the 'Drains' in Sorrento with a mixture of a package holiday resort. The Dauphine however, is surrounded by more 'French' feeling bars and restaurants and yet it is a quiet and relaxing oasis.We were kindly upgraded to a superior room after a simple exchange of emails, many thanks. Our room was no smaller than many typical English B&B's, but well furnished and appointed. I like small and quaint and that's what we got so a happy bunny! As has been said previously, the staff were all great, although we had most to do with Guy of whom we cannot speak highly enough. Extremely helpful, friendly and attentive, he should give lessons to people in how to give good customer service. Because of the 'French' disease (strikes) Guy checked our flight and ensured that our taxi would arrive, as he advised against taking the RER on 'the day of action', great service. Shame he's leaving for Bordeaux but maybe we should check out that City! We took breakfast every morning up the street in Le Buci, €8.50 good value. We ate at Vins et Terroirs, on Rue St Andre des Arts, unassuming but passable food; Le Christine on Rue Christine, more expensive but better quality and one other which I can't remember so enough said! We plan to go back to Paris and would definitely use the Dauphine again which in itself must be the best recommendation for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from wonderful staff make this central Paris location ideal for those who want to explore on foot..”
Reviews.Author: Christine2910
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, lovely shared facilities, helpful staff, free wireless Internet access and a central location made this an ideal place for us. Great bars and cafes all around, and lovely little shops as well. A chance encounter with Jacques Chirac was a bonus. Thanks Hotel Dauphine St Germain and Tanya our Travel Agent for arranging such a lovely hotel. Have already recommended that friends stay there - they are arranging at present.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: thewardly
Reviews.Content: Location and staff make the Hotel Dauphine the place to stay on the Left Bank. It is an easy walk to many of the major sites of Paris - the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame, etc. and the Rue St. Germain - and many fine restaurants. The staff was exceedingly pleasant and helpful in all respects and recommended several restaurants where we ate and enjoyed our meals. The rooms are small, in the European style, but well furnished and clean. The elevator is very cramped, so be prepared to use the stairs. We were on the fifth floor - - 101 steps! Breakfast is not included in the room rate, and is expensive, so find a creperie.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HSpu
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and to help us with directions, advice, etc. Although the rooms were somewhat small, everything was very clean and comfortable. The location could not have been better, very near the Metro, many restaurants, Notre Dame and the Louvre. A very lively and fun area.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks in the Dauphine - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: laprof
Reviews.Content: This year my husband and I were able to stay for 2 weeks in Paris and, of course, we chose the Dauphine as our hotel - again. I knew that there were a few changes in personnel during the previous year, so I was curious about the type of service we'd receive. (Two of the personnel were people we had gotten to know well throughout our many stays at the hotel.) The great news? The front desk team and the cleaning women were still excellent - I especially enjoyed being introduced to Farah by Guy and was delighted by her helpfulness and cheerfulness. Although there were some complaints about the new server, my husband and I never experienced any difficulties - so I guess we were some of the lucky guests! Shortly before the end of our stay, we were told that the server was in his final few days there and that a new server had been hired. From the most recent reviews of the hotel, it seems that guests are now very happy with all of the staff! Per usual, our room was well equipped, clean, quiet, and nicely climate controlled; the salon was well kept and provided a nice break for wine or cocktails; and the buffet breakfast supplied us with all the caloric intake necessary! And, per usual, the staff remained the true stars of the Dauphine.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back”
Reviews.Author: readerboehm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. It is in the Latin Quarter and a walk away from everything. Go left out of hotel and you are one block to the Seine then choose right to Notre Dame or left to Louvre. If you go right there are loads of Brassiere's and restaurants, shopiing and of course St. Germain. We liked using this metro for Eiffle tower and Versailles. Yes the rooms are small and I would pass on the expensive breakfast but really you are in Paris who atays in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: charlie_white72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for my birthday and our wedding anniversery, the hotel was perfect in every way. Lovely, clean, tidy and quiet room with free wifi. The staff were wondeful, very helpful, avaliable 24/7 and spoke perfect English. The location was amazing. 2 minutes from the river Seine, and 5 minutes to Notre Dame. The hotel was also only minutes from the streets of the Latin Quarter, filled with wonderful restaurants including Italian, Japaniense, Indian and French, as well as pretty little shops. You will not be disapointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: APepe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are newly married and we loved this hotel. Our room was somewhat small, but it was very nice. The location was ideal, practically everything was in walking distance, we only took the metro a few times during our visit. The neighborhood was very nice, and the staff was very nice and helped us with all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirltrundle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dauphine Saint Germaine was a great hotel. It met all my needs and your reception staff, housemaids and meals room staff were so friendly and helpful. I will recommend your hotel and stay again when in Paris. Thank-you!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a Wonderful time at Dauphine-St Germain”
Reviews.Author: Kaiser00
Reviews.Content: At the tail end of a somewhat stressful canal boat trip, we found an extremely comfortabale and hospitable stay at Dauphine St. Germain. We absolutely adore the St. Germain neighborhood, and Dauphine has the perfect location--quiet enough but close to everything your beautiful city has to offer. I even surprised myself at remembering how to get there from St Michel station!! Farah was very helpful getting us situated. and Guy was very helpful with a reservation at "d'Allard" which is my favorite Parisian restaurant. And I also want to thank the evening gentleman (did not get his name--a big guy possibly from south Asia) who was helpful with French lessons. This is not the typical expectation of an American to receive such personal treatment in Paris. We will definately be back. I have my previous employer (Arjo-Wiggins-USA) to thank for showing me your wonderful hotel. Thanks again--Jon and Barbara.

Reviews.Title: “The service and location make it an ideal place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: GMCKELLA
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean but very small. Television stations carried no English speaking programs. The shower door/water retainer glass was so short that water sprayed outside the shower onto the bathroom door and floor. The service, however, was excellent. The staff, especially Farah, has an in-depth knowledge of great places to dine, how to use public transportation, and tips on how to maximize your stay. We found the location to be within walking distance of historical sites,museums and public transportation. The breakfast bar has a good selection and was sufficient to satisfy the pallet. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strote
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dauphine was recommended by a friend and we're glad we chose it. We arrived in the morning and they let us right into the room. A small room, but perfectly wonderful. It was at the back of the hotel which meant the window opened on a large air shaft, but that was fine too. The sun shone in on a beautiful spring morning. Because we were at the back, it was very quiet. Slept like babies. We had breakfast at neighborhood cafes only because we wanted to get out into the streets. Right at the end of the street is the Pont Neuf - great location. We'd go back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rex-Imperator
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Paris numerous times and like to try different neighborhoods and different hotels. However, we tend to come back to St. Germain for it's central location and choice of restaurants. The Hotel Dauphine St. Germain is clearly a stand-out and it will be hard to imagine us staying anywhere else in the future. Our room was small (as most are in Paris) with a double bed, but very clean, quiet, nicely decorated and with a good-size bathroom. Where the Dauphine St. Germain excels is the friendly and helpful staff (as many hotels in Paris aren't.) We had the option of a continental breakfast or buffet. From the hotel entrance the Rue Dauphine crosses the Seine at Pont Neuf, and is a short 10 minute walk to the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay or Notre Dame. We couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “One word...Excellent”
Reviews.Author: stevejojo
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is rated as a 3 star I would rate the service as 7 star! Farrah went out of her way to ensure our stay in the Hotel Dauphine and Paris would exceed our expectations and it did!! The true delight though was Farrah's sincere desire to make sure all of our wishes came true! In fact she seemed to anticipate them! Guy was also there to ensure our needs were met. This is truly a sweet hotel that is located perfectly with lovely little rooms that are surprisingly very quiet given the hotel is located in a busy neighbourhood. I would recommend it to anyone and would certainly return. The true gem of this hotel though is the staff and the over the top service you will receive. Someone has done a truly wonderful job of hiring 7 star staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jpny71
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my wife to spend 5 nights in Paris by Tripadvisor rankings and write-ups, etc. This hotel rec'd mostly excellent reviews and I am adding to this. The staff was helpful and nice. The rooms were clean and furnished well and bathrooms were recnovated/new. For any first time Paris travelers you will find out that rooms in Paris are like New York City - smaller boutique type rooms - especially if you want to pay in the $200-300 USD range. The locatiion is perfect -- a quieter street in a cute neighborhood with restaurants and soho type shops around corner and great bars nearby as well. If you like to walk you can walk to museums and lots of tourist attractions and the Metro is within 5 minute walk. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: Jono17
Reviews.Content: Welcome and reception10/10. Handy spot near River Seine so easy access to best venues on Left (St Germain shopping, Sorbonne, Muse D'Orsay) and Right Bank (Notre Dame, Louvre and Marais District) within 30 minutes walk. Rooms are Paris small size and therefore swinging the cat will be a challenge but perfect for a long weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was charming and perfectly...”
Reviews.Author: Travellover62
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and perfectly placed to Notre Dame, Louvre, Musee d'orsay and many others. It was very, very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. For those from the US, the rooms are smaller than standard US hotels but this is typical for Europe. The cab from CDG was about 60 euros but the hotel can set you up with a service for 28 euros single rider and 40 for 2 riders. The free buffet that was included in my charge was more than adequate but you can order of the menu. If the buffet is not included the Buffet can be pricey at 16 euros. Around the corner are plenty of very good price fixed restaurants that for under 20 euros includes appetizer, entree and dessert (fondu to chautebriand). I highly recommend the hotel and the area!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service, very good breakfast. I will be returning with my clients soon.”
Reviews.Author: culturalstudyabroad
Reviews.Content: The management is very accessible and kind. Guy and the other hotel staff were lovely, always ready to help with a request. The location is right by Pont Neuf and the entertainment of the left bank. Culturalstudyabroad.com brings artists and photographers to Paris so we found this central hotel, very comfortable, very clean and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “TOP service and perfect location for us”
Reviews.Author: Copencouple
Reviews.Content: We like this area and found this hotel on the Internet at a special offer. We normally do not expect much when choosing Paris hotels this way, however, this was actually a surprise. Room was not big, but cozy, clean and nice. The service at the front desk was VERY good, kind, familiar and helpful in any matter and always with a smile. This was perfect for us and we will love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aggiemannix
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; welcoming and helpful staff, clean and lovely rooms. GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel with great staff - nice new decor and close to nightlife and shopping - a definite yes.”
Reviews.Author: Getlosttoexplore
Reviews.Content: Small and friendly hotel that was recommended to us by friends, near to everything you need for a short break in Paris. Paris rooms are small and this is no different but it is so well done and furnished that its irrelevant. The staff were so kind that when the lift broke they gave us a free breakfast - we were perfectly happy to walk up the stairs - great service. Its close to Metro stations, brasseries, 10 mins from Louvre and Notre Dame and 5 minutes walk from direct RER train to CDG airport - stay was perfect and we'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,friendly staff,rooms clean.”
Reviews.Author: triona73
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for touring the city,standard rooms small but clean and comfortable.Staff very friendly and helpful.We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I will choose again”
Reviews.Author: uffeDenmark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely renovated The staff is good. The location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DogStarChicago
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, our room assignment was right next to the elevator. Guy (am I spelling it correctly?) offered us a choice of alternate rooms & allowed us to choose. This had the immediate affects of improving our room assignment and made a very positive impression of the staff & desire to please the customer. Throughout our brief stay, Guy & Farrah were helpful, professional, friendly, knowledgeable.... In short, they made our brief time at the hotel a wonderful experience. The only negative was that the bed was as hard as a rock!

Reviews.Title: “A very good, quality hotel, in central location but not noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Astasiute
Reviews.Content: The welcoming of staff was very nice. The hotel itself is beautiful and charming, the room was good, the isolation of the rooms is perfect as well. No disadvantages could be added to this description.

Reviews.Title: “Relax & Love”
Reviews.Author: Evrika
Reviews.Content: I was so happy there, perfect time, perfect place, perfect hotel. I will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TitanRed
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful and handy location. Outside the hotel you have galaries, jewellery shops, choclatier, hat maker, toy store. All charming little establishments. Plenty of restaurants you can just walk to. Very close to Pont Neuf. You just walk across the bridge to Lourve, Rue du Rivoli. Halfway is Isle de City, Isle de St Louis. Notre Dame! So fantastic. The hotel is traditional, tiny rooms, tiny elevator but the staff are wonderfull, the hotel is very quaint and charming. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “A location that cant be beat”
Reviews.Author: Bailey1046
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was perfect due to our accomodations. the hotel staff were superb. they make you feel so welcome. They are patient and kind and always looking out for you. our window opened onto Rue Dauphine and we lived the paris life. if you prefer it quiet ask for a room in back of hotel. i loved the sounds of the evening. we were one block from Seine and Pont Neuf. we cant imagine staying anywhere else. the location is exceptional. we were close to everything. our room was cozy with twin beds and a modern bathroom and shower and very clean. our morning espresso was the best we had ever had. clean, comfortable and with the staff you cannot ask for more. we are back in June and will come as frequently as we can. it was a dream of mine to visit Paris and once you get a taste there is no turning back. we fell in love with her. stay at a hotel that takes care of you. we are recommending to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: mgnb28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dauphine has a great location and reasonable price. The amenities are suitable for any trip. The real feature is the friendly, helpful staff. I have stayed here for several years on business and holiday. The staff has had very little turnover, is very helpful and friendly. The staff makes the hotel feel like home. Although there is not a business center per se, they have accomidated all of my business needs (FAX, copies, printing, conference calls, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “spent a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: crt2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Dauphine for a few nights between christmas and new year. We spent a very good time there, the staff are very nice and helpful, the rooms have a great deal of charm and character. Apparently they are just finishing a big renovation, the rooms look all new.
