It will look better once the whole thing and the corridors are finished too. Location is excellent and acces is easy, the hotel is at walking distance from the Louvre, Notre Dame or Musee d'Orsay. The area around the hotel is very nice, with many nice shops, and very decent restaurants at a range of prices.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Maixo
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent hotel. Rooms are clean. The staff is present and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: muadib10191
Reviews.Content: I stayed1 week in this hotel. It si true, rooms are small (but in this area it seems to be a normal thing, ). Rooms have been renovated and decoration is really nice. Staff is really wonderful !!! they know everything regarding restaurants museums etc.........Location is perfect !!!

Reviews.Title: “Left Without Unpacking”
Reviews.Author: LightTravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel extolled in a (formerly) trusted guidebook, and affirming that review with comments on this site, we booked for our anniversary weekend. We arrived at the gloomy lobby at ten at night, where the clerk offered nothing in greeting and nothing more than grunts in response to ours. The lift jerked its way ominously up the floors, where we found a room only marginally larger than the box containing the pair of boots our daughter ordered last week. The rug was threadbare, the amenities were nil. This was a cell, more conducive to incarceration than celebration. We asked the desk whether they had anything better available. Non. So we started phoning around until we found a place nearby that could accommodate us for both nights. Sadly, based on this experience, I will be highly skeptical about the credibility of reporters to this site. We have lived in Paris and we have stayed there many times. We thought we would try someplace new rather than the hotels where we have been content in the past. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: TJohnk
Reviews.Content: Our younger daughter was studying abroad in Rennes and she met us in Paris. Our older daughter and her boyfriend also traveled with us. We had booked two rooms. One for daughter and boyfriend, which was small but very cute. The other room was for my husband, me and our other daughter (college student). We asked for an additional roll-away bed and the room was horrible. Way too small for three people and there was no where to even store 3 suitcases. We asked if the had anything larger and they showed us the suite which was available for an additional fee. It was very roomy and we switched. It cost an additional $500 (we stayed a week), but was worth it for the comfort. The staff was friendly. The location of this hotel was fantastic! Right in the heart of the Latin Quarter! If you are looking for the Parisian experience you will not be diasppointed in this area of the city. The cafes and shopping in the Latin Quarter was great. Only a block from the Seine and Pont Neuf. A couple blocks from Notre Dame and the Metro. FANTASTIC LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Forget Small Rooms, Think Location And Service”
Reviews.Author: DIPLOMAT1126
Reviews.Content: room was immaculate. bathroom very large. requested large bathroom. faced courtyard -very quiet , although the street is not noisy at all. small room did not bother me at all. it is in best location in paris . cafes all around. can walk late at night . safe. lots of people. staff very helpful and pleasant. helped book tours. let them book monet's house in giverney with cityrama . skip mouin rouge. staff called various restaurants to help me locate lost eyeglasses. thanks to their efforts I was able to find them. the manager,cedric, helped us to the cab at the end of our stay and assisted with luggage. i would definitely stay there again , and i am quite fussy when it comes to hotels and restaurants. great stay for all ages. we are in our sixties.

Reviews.Title: “great location with charm”
Reviews.Author: michleec
Reviews.Content: just stayed here a few days ago and would definitely recommend. The rooms have a nice balance of updated decor and old world charm. The location is within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame as well as sights in the Latin Quarter and St. Germaine des Pres. the rooms are quite small however. We had a superior and still found it cramped for the two of us. We didn't have the breakfast as it was an extra 16 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Another year, another great visit”
Reviews.Author: laprof
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from an 8 day stay at the Dauphine with my husband. This recent visit marks our 7th or 8th stay at the hotel - and we're still as delighted with it as always. Our room was located on the 5th floor (we've now stayed on every floor!) and was comfortable, extremely well kept, clean, and welcoming. As we know, each room in the Dauphine measures more or less the same in square meters, but the arrangement of each room means that some "feel" larger than others. This room was almost a perfect square with a good sized (and so clean!) bathroom. Each room has a mini-bar (nice to have late at night!), a phone (with credit card service available for international calls, if needed), excellent lighting, flat screen tv w/ many channels (including 2 in English - CNN and BBC - for my non-French speaking husband), an air-conditioning system that works flawlessly, and very tasteful decor. Downstairs on the same floor as the Reception and the dining area is a salon where we can have a cocktail, meet friends before going to dinner, and read. In addition to its excellent location right in the middle of a non-touristy street, the Dauphine has another excellent asset - its staff. To be welcomed by name (even after our first visit!) by Houda, Guy, Roland, and Najib at the front desk makes the Dauphine feel like home away from home. Our requests for taxis, restaurant reservations, and general information are provided with pleasure. Add the hospitality of Chantal and Jacqueline (who bring our cafe au lait with a smile and a greeting) and we know that we're staying in the right place. Restaurants abound in this neighborhood (or within a 5 minute stroll) from the inexpensive to the very expensive - depending on your mood and budget. There are two close metro stops - Odeon and Pont Neuf - so transportation is easy. In short, we'll be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great place for the lone traveller”
Reviews.Author: cmalconne
Reviews.Content: Staff here is wonderful, but the room was a bit smaller then most I have been in within Paris. Everything was clean and had a very nice large bathroom. Breakfast was standard Parisian hotel fare but alot of wonderful cafes nearby. Pricing was cheap considering the very central location to the major areas of Paris nightlife (at least on the tourist side).

Reviews.Title: “The best staff in the world!”
Reviews.Author: entropyorganizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first weekend in April. Seriously, we have never felt as welcome as we were here. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris, but this was the best. The room is small, but aren't all rooms in Paris? The only complaint is that we had to choose between warm still air at night or street noise. We opened the window to get some moving cool air and the street noise filled to room. Lots of cars and people all-night-long. OK at first, but it got old and we had to close the window at 3am. We got over it because it is a great location! Next time we will ask for a room that does not open to the main street (Dauphine).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, shabby chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJP7melb
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Dauphine in July 2008 and loved it! The location was wonderful. So close to the Louvre and just a bike ride away from the Eiffel Tower. The surrounding streets gave us a great feel for the real Paris. Buzzing at night with locals out drinking and eating- not that you could hear the street noise from the room (and we had a street facing room). The room was small but quaint. It was everything we wanted from a hotel- clean, well maintained and in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegElf
Reviews.Content: I've visited Paris several times and usually stay at 2 or 3 star hotels in this price range. I stayed here for seven nights by myself in early February. While I booked a standard double, I was upgraded to a superior double (room 14) at no extra charge. The room was far from the smallest I've stayed in in Paris (though not spacious) and the marble bathroom was truly luxurious for this class of hotel. Good toiletries and towels were provided, as was a hairdryer and heated towel bars. There was a bath and shower, and it was scrupulously clean. Everything worked. the room itself was elegantly furnished with cheerful yellow fabric on the walls, a large and comfortable bed, a good desk, two chairs and a wardrobe. Free wireless worked well all the time I was there -- not to be taken for granted in many parisien hotels. The room itself was quite dark because it overlooked an inner courtyard, but I expect that would be a blessing in the summer when tourist crowds make the streets noisy. This room was very quiet and I didn't even hear any neighbours through the walls, which usually annoys me in hotels in this price range. the breakfast is expensive at 16 euros, but it is better than most hotel breakfasts with good juice, yoghurts, boiled eggs, meats, cheese, bread, croissants, cereals and pastries. Excellent coffee, chocolate and tea were available. There is also a hot selection that didn't vary for the week I stayed there: sausages, spinach, baked beans and fritatta. If you're saving money, there are many restaurants and cafes in the area that will provide a petit dejeuner francais (continental) at 6.50 and a petit dejeuner americain ou anglais (with meat and eggs) at 8.50, but I enjoyed the cheerful breakfast room and friendly attendants. Moreover, it is very convenient to breakfast in the hotel. The location can't be beat. It's right on the RER B line, so you can take the train directly from CDG without worrying about transferring with luggage. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from the station (and St. Michel, Notre Dame etc). The staff tolerated my attempts to speak French, and effortlessly switched to English when necessary. They went out of their way to make my stay very comfortable and enjoyable. There are many excellent restaurants and cafes in the area. I highly recommend "La rotisserie en face" on rue christine. It's a bit expensive, but has wonderful French food including excellent guinea fowl in pastry (Moroccan?), and really good rotisserie chicken. "La Bergamote", very nearby, was also excellent -- much cheaper than "la rotisserie" and quite creative. Dauphine St Germain is a very French hotel, by which I mean that if you like big rooms with lots of light, coffeemakers, and so on, you should pay more and stay in tourist hotels that cater to North Americans. If, however, you want more comfort than is typical at this price range and a reasonably authentic stay, this is a wonderful hotel. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not meant for a special occasion stay”
Reviews.Author: pegsu
Reviews.Content: I booked The Dauphine, knowing it was a three star, but it got some good reviews on this and other websites, and thought "we won't be in the room very much anyway". We booked a package through Amex, and on arrival, they knew nothing about the package (breakfast included, fruit basket on arrival, romantic river cruise). The room was so small and dingy you couldn't walk around the bed. I went to the front desk and asked for a larger room as it was our Anniversary and we were happy to pay more for more room and the clerk, told me I had too high expectations, this is what Parisian hotels were like, but I could try to find something better. Well, thats exactly what we did, we stayed one (very noisy, bad pillows, very uncomfortable bed) night and moved to Hotel Christine, a charming very high service level lovely hotel, right around the corner. More money, no question, but proving you get what you pay for. The only thing I will agree with the other reviews is the locations is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced/Tired”
Reviews.Author: jpuigpey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for business and were booked at the Dauphine Saint Germain by my company's travel agent. It WAS extremely well located, as she promised, but quite a disappointment in several other ways. We arrived there with plenty of luggage as we had been traveling in Europe for several weeks. Much to my dismay, were placed on a floor that the elevator did not reach. I had to precariously drag 3 heavy suitcases down a full flight of stairs to make it to the room. Once I opened the room door, I realized there was a strange, winding and narrow hallway to get into the room itself with not an inch of extra space to stack suitcases. The bathroom was also narrow and extremely uncomfortable--the shower so small that I was unable to pick up the shampoo from the shower floor. They did change the room for us the following day, but unfortunately the second room was only slightly more comfortable and quite dingy/old/run-down. I realize pickings in Paris are slim for a well-sized room at a good price--but for $230Euros, I expected a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: annettedg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine St. Germain hotel with our teenage daughter at the beginning of August 08. The hotel was easy to find and is very centrally located in Paris. It is fairly close to the Odeon station and you can walk to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter where we ate practically every night. (You can't beat the prices of the restaurants there!) The room was very small with a narrow corridor leading to the private bath. It looked out on a tiny courtyard which made us feel somewhat claustrophobic. Because of the extra bed for our daughter, there was no space to walk around and we had some trouble storing our luggage. It was clean, however, and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. The price was reasonable for Paris and for this fantastic location. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Liked: location, comfortable beds, cleanliness Disliked: Old fashioned safe in the room which required us carrying around a large key.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Todd98
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quaint little hotel in the St. Germain area of the left bank, this is the place. Excellent location, with all major sites in walking distance. While the rooms are typically-Paris small, they are clean, nicely decorated, and well-equipped. Our only complaint was the wireless internet was not working. The front desk staff (especially the young woman working day shift) was so helpful!! I have stayed in other hotels in the area before and they do not compare. I will book at Dauphine again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, central with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RobertKaren
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here with my 3 kids for 3 nights. We were welcomed by a friendly staff member and shown to our rooms. Typical Paris hotel rooms, small but comfortable. The kids' room was of similar size maybe slightly bigger and a 3rd bed (fold out type) was nestled against one of the walls. The fold out bed fell apart that night but thery replaced it with a more sturdier model the next day. The location is ideal, 300m from the Seine, 300 m from Rue St German, some lovely little clothes shops and restaurants galore. Breakfast was nice, typical buffet style with plenty of choices. We are going back to Paris in September and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “tres french - petit bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bettybooLondon
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. very french. room wonderful. very very small bed for my six foot four boyfriend! all in all great location. we loved and would go back if bigger beds or smaller boyfriend!!!! lets hope for bigger beds!!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for paris”
Reviews.Author: jubileejan
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband were taking my dad to paris for one night and wanted to be in the centre of things as time was so short but also wanted a quiet decent hotel as my dad is 75. i went on trip advisor and all reviews were good for this hotel. we would normally go for a 4 star or above just to be sure of the quality but went on the advice of over travellers to this 3 star hotel and was so pleased we did. rooms were small, which was expected but were spotlessly clean and of a very decent standard. staff were very very friendly and helpful and made you feel that nothing was too much trouble. breakfast was ok, plenty of it and a good choice. we were close to many sites and found this really helpful. would definately have no problem in recommending this hotel to family or friends and would stay there again. third trip to paris and this was by far the best hotel we have stayed in. we arrived too early to check in but could leave our bags and staff offered to get room ready for us in an hour. considering we had arrived 3 hours too early we thought this was very good of them. if i had to find one thing wrong it would be that there were no coffee/tea facilities in the room but as we were only there for one night and going straight down for breakfast it was not a problem. lots of friendly reasonably priced places to eat in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fine 6e Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aklein1022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dauphine St. Germain for six nights, starting 2/11. Our first time in this hotel but we are very familiar with the area. We stayed in Room 66 – on the sixth floor. The room was small – what else!, but had a hallway that separated the bedroom from the bathroom. This felt odd at first, but it provided the sense that the room was actually bigger than it was. The bathroom was tiny as well with a stand-up shower and no bath. Only one person could use the bathroom at a time. The nicest feature about the room was the view from the small hallway window where you could see the Eiffel Tower and the gold dome of the Invalides. At night, the view was especially good with the EF in lights. The room was cleaned daily with fresh linens and towels. Our hotel deal included breakfast, which was more than adequate to get your day going. Mostly cold buffet foods – yogurt, fresh and canned fruit salads, croissant/breads, cheese and meats, OJ, and hard boiled eggs. Noticed some hot food but couldn’t really tell you what they had. And of course really good coffee! Served in a small but airy room. One day we asked for breakfast in our room which they were quick to bring up, for a small charge. As previously mentioned, the lift is small but certainly adequate for one person with luggage, or two to three people without. All Paris hotel lifts are small and this one is no different. During our stay the lift broke twice and it took nearly a day to repair. Had to walk the six flights up one time. Hey, things break. Wonderful staff – front desk, breakfast room, housekeepers. Would probably go back. Good value for the price and location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “parisian heaven”
Reviews.Author: 62jem
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching we finally decided on this hotel for our first weekend away without the kids in 14 years - hence we wanted it to be special. We contacted the hotel by email explaining exactly what we wanted and they did not disappoint us. In fact by going direct we got a bonus of breakfast included in the rate. The room was excellent, clean, warm and inviting and parisian. I did not want to wake up where I could have been in any hotel room anywhere in the world - I wanted to know I was in paris!! The bathroom was small and the bath ok for small folk, but it was all spotlessly clean with soft fluffy towels. The lift is small but who spends long in there anyway. The staff were polite, helpful and there if you needed them - not pushy / arrogant or missing! The best thing about this hotel is its location. Arriving from the airport its easy to get to on RER B and then a 400m walk. You are very close to the Seine and an easy stroll to the Louvre / Notre Dame / Bvd. St Germain. Many superb restaurants/bistros nearby. We absolutely loved Paris and hope to return there soon along with the rest of the family. Next time we won't waste hours searching for the perfect Parisian hotel because we have already found it.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian charm”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine St Germain is a solid 3 star French hotel. Rooms seem to be average for this class of hotel in Paris. Good location, easy access to Metro, lots of cafés and restaurants nearby. The concierges were always helpful—with directions, with restaurant recommendations, etc. I stayed here for two nights on business, so my company made the reservations. The corporate price we paid is lower than what’s advertised on the website, and breakfast was included. I arrived early, as usual for flights from the U.S. and my room wasn’t ready. The room I had requested was the 6th floor suite (#61), but check out isn’t until noon and the previous guests hadn’t checked out yet. However, the concierge gave me another room (#31) to rest in until my reserved room was ready. #31 was small, but quite functional and would have been fine—although it would have been a tight fit with my large bags. The 6th floor suite was quite pretty, with wood floors (bring slippers) and a small separate dressing area with a wardrobe and day bed. The bedroom itself was relatively large. The décor included warm yellow fabric on the walls, which turned the room a bright gold on sunny mornings as the small windows faced east. The view out the east windows was of Paris rooftops (a favorite view of mine), including the top of Notre Dame and the Pantheon. One of the nice things about the suite is that there was a real queen sized bed—not two twin beds pushed together (as in #31). The bed wasn’t plush, but was comfortable enough. They really need to get new pillows, though. The heat worked well when I was there in mid-December. I didn’t try the air conditioning, but since this is an attic room, it might get quite warm during a heat wave in the summer. The bathrooms (in both the single room and the suite) are well lit and completely updated. The bathroom in the suite was large and bright. The entire hotel seemed very clean and well maintained. Not shabby. Breakfast downstairs is adequate, and could also be had in the room. Overall, this hotel is as I said at the beginning—a solid 3-star hotel. In Paris, this means that the rooms are smallish (by American standards) and clean, the amenities are functional and not luxurious (no high-end toiletries, no robe), but everything you need is here and the front desk staff will do its best to see that you have a pleasant stay. I’d return here on my next trip (I travel to Paris several times a year), especially if I could book the suite again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Restuarants & Louvre”
Reviews.Author: ang777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February. The rooms were nice, decorated in a very traditional french style and were clean. They were not very big, but this is quite typical of Parisian hotels. The location was great as there are lots restaurants to choose from on the same street as the hotel and it is in walking distance of the Louvre. The Eiffel Tower is further away but there are buses which you can get up to it. We found the hotel staff to be helpful and gave us directions on our maps and advice on the best buses etc. Overall it is a nice hotel and very handy to a wide range of restaurants and the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose it!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda681
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior double for 184 euros about 10 months in advance, room 54. The bed was quite large and the room had enough space for our gigantic suitcase and some smaller bags. The flatscreen tv and the fridge with drinks was an added bonus. The bathroom was as large as any at a hotel in the states. We didn't do the breakfast since it is twice the price of going to a nearby cafe. The people at the front desk all spoke English and were very nice, especially helping us arrange the Airport shuttle and calling when they were late. The one strange thing was having to leave our key at the front desk whenever we left the hotel, but maybe this is common in Paris. The location, near the river and all the action on the left bank, can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: niner710
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for Paris standards. If you are from America then you will find this room tiny but from my experiences in Paris it is not bad. Paid about $165 for a double room during the August months. The staff is friendly and courteus and the location in the latin quarter is really nice. Rooms are pretty clean. About a 5 minute walk from the Notre Dame and metro station is really close. There is free internet access down in the basement. Only bad part was that the elevator was really small and the breakfast cost 15 euros, which is not really a big deal since lot of shops around the hotel where you can have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: martjen
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of St. Germain but on a quiet side street. Room was tiny, but at least the windows opened. Bathroom was clean and fairly spacious. Staff was friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TeamDixon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Dauphine Saint Germain. We loved the location- a quick walk away Notre Dame and the Louvre and equally close to the Latin Quarter for great late night snacks and drinks. The staff was amazing...Abdel (I think that's right) the PM desk person was THE BEST! He knew our names on the second day and was so helpful and friendly. He made our stay. Our room was fine- we were on the 6th floor and had a decent view. The room was tiny, although there was a long hallway within our room, which gave us the feeling we had a little more space. The breakfast was good (included in our room rate that we booked) and there were plenty of good cafes close by. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, decent room with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Room 14 is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: rmluke
Reviews.Content: Though in a great location, five minutes walk from Notre Dame, this hotel was a severe disappointment. Room 14 was tiny, the airconditioning/heating unit was very noisy, and provided insufficient heat, and the shower efficiently flooded the bathroom while making the person taking the shower only mildly damp. Having staggered down to breakfast after a sleepless night, and still half showered, we then had an unpleasant lady refusing our request to sit at a four person table and insisting that we sit at another one. Needless to say, the whole time we were at breakfast no four person party occupied that table. All in all 1 out 5.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel in perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kattka
Reviews.Content: What a great location!! We stayed in this lovely hotel only for one night but would come here again. Located by the river and just two blocks away from Notre Dam. We stayed in the room on the 6th floor with the view to the courtyard. The room was small but very nice, quiet, clean and felt like at home. The bathroom was exceptionally clean. The staff was amazing, very helpful, pleasant and nice. We had to check-out at 12:00 but could leave our bags at the reception until late evening! They serve breakfast as well for €15 but we chose to have breakfast in one of the many local cafés I would strongly recommend any visitor who would like to stay in Paris to book a hotel in St. Germain-de-Pres area. You can walk everywhere - Louvre, Notre Dam and many more attractions. The whole area is filled with lovely cafes, restaurants and beautiful streets and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier_from_AUS
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be luxurious, however the location is sensational. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful and the rooms, whilst small, were clean, pleasant and enjoyable to stay in. Would highly recommend as the location is fantastic, good staff, clean pleasant rooms, and quite charming overall.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dauphine Saint Germain
HotelInfo.Address: 36 Rue Dauphine | 6th Arr., 75006 Paris, France
